org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.regalloc

Class RegisterAllocatorState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jikesrvm.compilers.opt.regalloc.RegisterAllocatorState

  • public class RegisterAllocatorState
extends Object
    The register allocator currently caches a bunch of state in the IR; This class provides accessors to this state.
    • TODO: Consider caching the state in a lookaside structure.
    • TODO: Currently, the physical registers are STATIC! fix this.

      • resetPhysicalRegisters

        void resetPhysicalRegisters(IR ir)
        Resets the physical register info.

      • setSpill

        void setSpill(Register reg,

      • getSpill

        public int getSpill(Register reg)

      • mapOneToOne

        void mapOneToOne(Register A,
                 Register B)
        Records that register A and register B are associated with each other in a bijection.

        The register allocator uses this state to indicate that a symbolic register is presently allocated to a physical register.

        Parameters:
        A - first register
        B - second register

      • getMapping

        Register getMapping(Register r)
        Parameters:
        r - a register
        Returns:
        the register currently mapped 1-to-1 to r

      • clearOneToOne

        void clearOneToOne(Register r)
        Clears any 1-to-1 mapping for a register.
        Parameters:
        r - the register whose mapping is to be cleared

      • getInterval

        CompoundInterval getInterval(Register reg)
        Returns the interval associated with the passed register.
        Parameters:
        reg - the register
        Returns:
        the live interval or null

      • initializeDepthFirstNumbering

        void initializeDepthFirstNumbering(int instructionCount)
        Initializes data structures for depth first numbering.
        Parameters:
        instructionCount - an estimate of the total number of instructions.

      • setInterval

        void setInterval(Register reg,
                 CompoundInterval interval)
        Associates the passed live interval with the passed register.
        Parameters:
        reg - the register
        interval - the live interval

      • setDFN

        void setDFN(Instruction inst,
            int dfn)
        Associates the passed dfn number with the instruction
        Parameters:

        dfn - the dfn number

      • getDFN

        public int getDFN(Instruction inst)
        returns the dfn associated with the passed instruction
        Parameters:
        inst - the instruction
        Returns:
        the associated dfn

      • printDfns

        void printDfns(IR ir)
        Prints the DFN numbers associated with each instruction.
        Parameters:
        ir - the IR that contains the instructions

      • getDfnBegin

        int getDfnBegin(LiveIntervalElement live,
                BasicBlock bb)
        Parameters:
        live - the live interval
        bb - the basic block for the live interval
        Returns:
        the Depth-first-number of the beginning of the live interval. If the interval is open-ended, the dfn for the beginning of the basic block will be returned instead.

      • getDfnEnd

        int getDfnEnd(LiveIntervalElement live,
              BasicBlock bb)
        Parameters:
        live - the live interval
        bb - the basic block for the live interval
        Returns:
        the Depth-first-number of the end of the live interval. If the interval is open-ended, the dfn for the end of the basic block will be returned instead.
